Well...But How I save game Data...???? Please Tell me...
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Our App is not for game creation, just playing games made in RPG Maker 2000/2003.
You can use any folder on your internal storage/SD card for games, just need to add the path in the options.
It is up to these games on how they add save functionality, mostly you can reach it through the menu.

It's a great app. It does what it's supposed to do, and it's probably the best RPG Maker emulator on the Play Store. Most games I played with this app worked without fail (besides JoJo, the shift key doesn't work, but there are logs for that on the easyrpg website). The Gray Garden and Wadanohara are among my favorites! It is ad-free too, so there should be no interruptions during gameplay. However, the app only supports RPG Maker 2000 and 2003 games, and there are only so many good games for those versions. This of course means games such as Pok√©mon Uranium, Mad Father, and Misao won't work, as Uranium uses a different version of RPG Maker, and the other two use WOLF RPG Editor, not RPG Maker (so do your research before installing a game into EasyRPG)! Overall, if you want to play some RPG Maker games on the go, this is a great option. I hope that in the future later iterations of RPG Maker are implemented! Keep up the good work!  EDIT: I would also like to add some info about fonts for anyone looking in the reviews! EasyRPG uses a different font than usual on PC, but some games use special fonts for different situations and symbols that EasyRPG can't recognize. For example, in Mother - Cognitive Dissonance, Mr. Saturn uses a custom font, which is translated into random symbols in EasyRPG. I hope EasyRPG changes this to work later.

It works perfectly! Still have to try out other games but for now the only issue is the text skulls but i am aware that is a text format i do not have on my phone. I believe missing textures would just be a issue with your download as i have not run into any personally.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We currently do not use the custom EXFONT provided by some games, so sometimes you get such funny symbols where they do not belong. You can always email us with further questions... ;-)

How to import an existing rtp game?
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
You can simply extract the game and rtp files to your phone. Either use the default game folder or add a custom one.
It should work. You can always contact us via email for further questions.

So far I've only tried to play .flow, and it's worked perfectly so far. The only error I've found is that there was a small graphical error in the underwater area - the lower row of roof tiles on Oreko's house showed up as all black rather than the proper tiles. It's a very minor error though, and didn't affect gameplay at all.   My only other critique is that a clearer explanation of how to get games running would be good (namely explicitly stating that you need to download the game from the internet, unzip the game folder, and move it to the right directory). I figured it out on my own but it seems like a few others didn't based on some of the other reviews.  Overall I'm very happy to have a way to play RPGMaker games on mobile, even if there are some quirks right now.

Great App, it keeps getting better on each update, there is one thing that I want to know, is it possible to assign sound fonts (.sf2) to replace the internal midi sequencer of the app? The one the app has is very primitive compared to a Yamaha type of sound font. Maybe by pairing it with another app or something running in the background? It can really be useful for this app, as many Rm2003 games use midi files.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Yeah, we had to choose a GUS patchset that is not too big and freely available, but it is not the best of course.
Adding support for soundfonts is possible, but currently not on our TODO list for the Android app.
While the actual music playing part is easily solvable by adding FluidLite library, the GUI part (select, etc.) is much more work.
